<Link id="l00001" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===- Signals.cpp - Generic Unix Signals Implementation -----&#42;- C++ -&#42;-===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00002" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00003" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Part of the LLVM Project, under the Apache License v2.0 with LLVM Exceptions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00004" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// See https://llvm.org/LICENSE.txt for license information.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00005" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0 WITH LLVM-exception</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00006" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00007" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This file defines some helpful functions for dealing with the possibility of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Unix signals occurring while your program is running.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This file is extremely careful to only do signal-safe things while in a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// signal handler. In particular, memory allocation and acquiring a mutex</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// while in a signal handler should never occur. ManagedStatic isn&#39;t usable from</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// a signal handler for 2 reasons:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  1 Creating a new one allocates.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  2 The signal handler could fire while llvm&#95;shutdown is being processed, in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     which case the ManagedStatic is in an unknown state because it could</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     already have been destroyed, or be in the process of being destroyed.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Modifying the behavior of the signal handlers (such as registering new ones)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// can acquire a mutex, but all this guarantees is that the signal handler</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// behavior is only modified by one thread at a time. A signal handler can still</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// fire while this occurs!</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Adding work to a signal handler requires lock-freedom (and assume atomics are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// always lock-free) because the signal handler could fire while new work is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// being added.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/lib/support/unix/unix-h">Unix.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><span class="doxyHighlight">          </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">continue</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Leave an empty filename.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><span class="doxyHighlight">        OldFilename = Current-&gt;Filename.exchange(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The filename might have become null between the time we</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// compared it and we exchanged it.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (OldFilename)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><span class="doxyHighlight">          free(OldFilename);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><span class="doxyHighlight">      &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> removeFile(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">char</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;path) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Get the status so we can determine if it&#39;s a file or directory. If we</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// can&#39;t stat the file, ignore it.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight">stat buf;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (stat(path, &amp;buf) != 0)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If this is not a regular file, ignore it. We want to prevent removal</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// of special files like /dev/null, even if the compiler is being run</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// with the super-user permissions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!S&#95;ISREG(buf.st&#95;mode))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Otherwise, remove the file. We ignore any errors here as there is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// nothing else we can do.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167"><span class="doxyHighlight">    unlink(path);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="168"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Signal-safe.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="171"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> removeAllFiles(std::atomic&lt;FileToRemoveList &#42;&gt; &amp;Head) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If cleanup were to occur while we&#39;re removing files we&#39;d have a bad time.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Make sure we&#39;re OK by preventing cleanup from doing anything while we&#39;re</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="174"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// removing files. If cleanup races with us and we win we&#39;ll have a leak,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="175"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// but we won&#39;t crash.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="176"><span class="doxyHighlight">    FileToRemoveList &#42;OldHead = Head.exchange(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="177"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="178"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (FileToRemoveList &#42;currentFile = OldHead; currentFile;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="179"><span class="doxyHighlight">         currentFile = currentFile-&gt;Next.load()) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="180"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If erasing was occuring while we&#39;re trying to remove files we&#39;d look</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="181"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// at free&#39;d data. Take away the path and put it back when done.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="182"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">char</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;path = currentFile-&gt;Filename.exchange(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">)) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="183"><span class="doxyHighlight">        removeFile(path);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="184"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00185" /><CodeLine lineNumber="185"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We&#39;re done removing the file, erasing can safely proceed.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="186"><span class="doxyHighlight">        currentFile-&gt;Filename.exchange(path);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="187"><span class="doxyHighlight">      &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="188"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="189"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="190"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We&#39;re done removing files, cleanup can safely proceed.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="191"><span class="doxyHighlight">    Head.exchange(OldHead);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="192"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="193"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="194"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> std::atomic&lt;FileToRemoveList &#42;&gt; FilesToRemove = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="195"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="196"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Clean up the list in a signal-friendly manner.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="197"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Recall that signals can fire during llvm&#95;shutdown. If this occurs we should</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="198"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// either clean something up or nothing at all, but we shouldn&#39;t crash!</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="199"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight">FilesToRemoveCleanup &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="200"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Not signal-safe.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="201"><span class="doxyHighlight">  ~FilesToRemoveCleanup() &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="202"><span class="doxyHighlight">    FileToRemoveList &#42;Head = FilesToRemove.exchange(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (Head)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">delete</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Head;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125; </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// namespace</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Argv0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Signals that represent requested termination. There&#39;s no bug or failure, or</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// if there is, it&#39;s not our direct responsibility. For whatever reason, our</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// continued execution is no longer desirable.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> IntSigs&#91;&#93; = &#123;SIGHUP, SIGINT, SIGTERM, SIGUSR2&#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Signals that represent that we have a bug, and our prompt termination has</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// been ordered.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> KillSigs&#91;&#93; = &#123;SIGILL,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="224"><span class="doxyHighlight">                               SIGQUIT</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="234"><span class="doxyHighlight">                               ,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="237"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#ifdef SIGEMT</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="238"><span class="doxyHighlight">                               ,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="241"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="242"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="243"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Signals that represent requests for status.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="244"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> InfoSigs&#91;&#93; = &#123;SIGUSR1</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="251"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> NumSigs = std::size(IntSigs) + std::size(KillSigs) +</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="252"><span class="doxyHighlight">                              std::size(InfoSigs) + 1 </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/&#42; SIGPIPE &#42;/</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="253"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="254"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> std::atomic&lt;unsigned&gt; NumRegisteredSignals = 0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="255"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="256"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight">sigaction SA;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="257"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> SigNo;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="258"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125; RegisteredSignalInfo&#91;NumSigs&#93;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="259"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="260"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#if defined(HAVE&#95;SIGALTSTACK)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="261"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Hold onto both the old and new alternate signal stack so that it&#39;s not</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="262"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// reported as a leak. We don&#39;t make any attempt to remove our alt signal</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="263"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// stack if we remove our signal handlers; that can&#39;t be done reliably if</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00264" /><CodeLine lineNumber="264"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// someone else is also trying to do the same thing.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00265" /><CodeLine lineNumber="265"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> stack&#95;t OldAltStack;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="266"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/compiler-h/#a6881c00738b22a600dfee25a1c32dab3">LLVM&#95;ATTRIBUTE&#95;USED</a> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;NewAltStackPointer;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00267" /><CodeLine lineNumber="267"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="268"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> CreateSigAltStack() &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00269" /><CodeLine lineNumber="269"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> AltStackSize = MINSIGSTKSZ + 64 &#42; 1024;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00270" /><CodeLine lineNumber="270"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00271" /><CodeLine lineNumber="271"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If we&#39;re executing on the alternate stack, or we already have an alternate</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00272" /><CodeLine lineNumber="272"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// signal stack that we&#39;re happy with, there&#39;s nothing for us to do. Don&#39;t</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00273" /><CodeLine lineNumber="273"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// reduce the size, some other part of the process might need a larger stack</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00274" /><CodeLine lineNumber="274"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// than we do.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00275" /><CodeLine lineNumber="275"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (sigaltstack(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">, &amp;OldAltStack) != 0 ||</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00276" /><CodeLine lineNumber="276"><span class="doxyHighlight">      OldAltStack.ss&#95;flags &amp; SS&#95;ONSTACK ||</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00277" /><CodeLine lineNumber="277"><span class="doxyHighlight">      (OldAltStack.ss&#95;sp &amp;&amp; OldAltStack.ss&#95;size &gt;= AltStackSize))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00278" /><CodeLine lineNumber="278"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00279" /><CodeLine lineNumber="279"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00280" /><CodeLine lineNumber="280"><span class="doxyHighlight">  stack&#95;t AltStack = &#123;&#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00281" /><CodeLine lineNumber="281"><span class="doxyHighlight">  AltStack.ss&#95;sp = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static&#95;cast&lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">char</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">&gt;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a8bb931812d78f470d4ca775ac8b88e61">safe&#95;malloc</a>(AltStackSize));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00282" /><CodeLine lineNumber="282"><span class="doxyHighlight">  NewAltStackPointer = AltStack.ss&#95;sp; </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Save to avoid reporting a leak.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00283" /><CodeLine lineNumber="283"><span class="doxyHighlight">  AltStack.ss&#95;size = AltStackSize;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00284" /><CodeLine lineNumber="284"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (sigaltstack(&amp;AltStack, &amp;OldAltStack) != 0)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00285" /><CodeLine lineNumber="285"><span class="doxyHighlight">    free(AltStack.ss&#95;sp);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00286" /><CodeLine lineNumber="286"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00287" /><CodeLine lineNumber="287"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#else</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00288" /><CodeLine lineNumber="288"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> CreateSigAltStack() &#123;&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00289" /><CodeLine lineNumber="289"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#endif</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00290" /><CodeLine lineNumber="290"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00291" /><CodeLine lineNumber="291"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> RegisterHandlers() &#123; </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Not signal-safe.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00292" /><CodeLine lineNumber="292"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The mutex prevents other threads from registering handlers while we&#39;re</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00293" /><CodeLine lineNumber="293"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// doing it. We also have to protect the handlers and their count because</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00294" /><CodeLine lineNumber="294"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// a signal handler could fire while we&#39;re registering handlers.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00295" /><CodeLine lineNumber="295"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/managedstatic">ManagedStatic&lt;sys::SmartMutex&lt;true&gt;</a>&gt; SignalHandlerRegistrationMutex;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00296" /><CodeLine lineNumber="296"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/#a1094ec958353ee43bd8ffd18187b1160">sys::SmartScopedLock&lt;true&gt;</a> Guard(&#42;SignalHandlerRegistrationMutex);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00297" /><CodeLine lineNumber="297"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00298" /><CodeLine lineNumber="298"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If the handlers are already registered, we&#39;re done.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00299" /><CodeLine lineNumber="299"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (NumRegisteredSignals.load() != 0)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00300" /><CodeLine lineNumber="300"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00315" /><CodeLine lineNumber="315"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">case</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> SignalKind::IsKill:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00316" /><CodeLine lineNumber="316"><span class="doxyHighlight">      NewHandler.sa&#95;handler = SignalHandler;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="318"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">break</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="323"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00325" /><CodeLine lineNumber="325"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00326" /><CodeLine lineNumber="326"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Install the new handler, save the old one in RegisteredSignalInfo.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="327"><span class="doxyHighlight">    sigaction(Signal, &amp;NewHandler, &amp;RegisteredSignalInfo&#91;Index&#93;.SA);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00784" /><CodeLine lineNumber="784"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// In the case of a program crash or fault, print out a stack trace so that the</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00786" /><CodeLine lineNumber="786"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00788" /><CodeLine lineNumber="788"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// doesn&#39;t demangle symbols.</span></CodeLine>
